flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
Small step by step guide on how to use the PWM (Pulse Width Modulation) of the Arduino board. The video includes the components needed and an easy to follow connection guide, as well as a demo of the results obtained. The code is also included.

We will use a potentiometer to vary the speed of a motor. The mini project forms the basis of how PWM works, and is a good and easy example to get started with.

http://www.youtube.com/embed/Ck7q8RvxnwM

Try it out yourself, enjoy! :D

Tools
  • 6v DC motor 600rpm
  • 330 ohm resistor
  • Arduino Uno
  • Diodes, 1N4001
  • Potentiometer, 100kΩ
  • Small Breadboard
  • Small Flathead Screwdriver
  • Transistor PN 2222
  • Wire
  • Wire cutter/stripper
